Posts.Content: I am now 5 weeks post op, still waiting for a date to start date for radiotherapy apparently they are awaiting the results of the FISH test!!! Anyway I now have a pain just below my right shoulder blade which is annoying and makes it uncomfortable to sleep on my right side. It is no where near my operation site so I am unsure as to what could be causing this.
Posts.Title: Post-Op back pain

Posts.Content: I have just completed a 3 week course of radiotherapy, I am feeling fine, wasn't sure what to expect, but I continued to work all the way through. If I am honest keeping myself busy is a welcome distraction from my illness, it still feels a bit surreal as I don't feel or look "unwell".  I have booked next week off, just to recharge my batteries. I don't have my outpatients appointment until mid December, in the meantime I have an education day and a pampering event to look forward to.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: I haven't had any time off during my illness except 3 weeks after my surgery. I feel better than I thought I would, that's probably why it feels so unreal.  I feel a little tired but I think that is the combination of the treatment and travelling to the the hospital everyday for three weeks.   Getting your cancer diagnosis certainly does give you a new perspective on life to value those things that are important like family and good friends.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - week 3 of 3

Posts.Content: I was impressed that I got an appointment for the breast clinic less than 2 weeks after being referred by my GP.  Despite the fact that I spent 4 hours at the hospital today it was worth the wait to be told that the "lump" was caused by scar tissue which resulted from surgery and radiotherapy.  Now I can get on and look forward to my holiday at the end of September.
Posts.Title: concerned about a lump

Posts.Content: I found a lump near the area where I had my lumpectomy in 2016 should I be worried, I am going to the hospital on Friday to get it checked out.
Posts.Title: concerned about a lump

Posts.Content: If all goes well, I am told I will need at least 2 weeks for post op recovery.  What sort of practical support will I need from family and friends during this time as I live on my own.
Posts.Title: Post-Op care

Posts.Content: That's useful to know, I am happy to delegate my housework to someone else .  I am lucky to have good friends as my sister has not been supportive, ok she lives down south but hasn't offered to come and see me because of work commitments, she wants me to go and stay with her for her convenience, to say I am annoyed is putting it mildly. I know who I can rely on in difficult times.
Posts.Title: Post-Op care

Posts.Content: I recently started taking anastozole and I have had a dull headache for several days now, has anybody else had experience of the same.
Posts.Title: Anastrozole - side effects

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy and lymph node biopsy just under 3 weeks ago, went to see the consultant today and I don't need any further surgery, but I am still waiting on test results to determine whether I need chemotherapy as well as radiotherapy. I am feeling much less stressed and anxious now that treatment has started.  I am planning to go back to work soon, if only part-time, to be honest I am bored
Posts.Title: Post Op results

Posts.Content: Hi I think I am waiting for the her2 test results to be honest I didn't take in everything the consultant was saying, as I was so relieved to hear that I didn't need further surgery. I am definitely having radiotherapy and hormone therapy, the outcome of the test will determine whether I have chemo as well, but I hoping it does not come to that given the side effects. I hope all goes well with you too.
Posts.Title: Post Op results

Posts.Content: Hi I am going back to the hospital next week, hopefully I will know the results by then. Work has been very supportive, I have only been there 18 months but they sent me lovely cards and some flowers. I feel lucky to work for a lovely organisation, as I know the job I had before would not have been so understanding.
Posts.Title: Post Op results

Posts.Content: Hi I thought likewise, that I would get all the results when I saw the consultant yesterday.  There seems to be a lot of waiting around, but at least I am not as stressed out and anxious as I was before I got my diagnosis just over a month ago. I am also waiting for the her2 test results, I have an appointment next week so hopefully will have the results by then.
Posts.Title: Post Op results

Posts.Content: Got through my first full week of radiotherapy and I feel fine so far. I plan to continue working if I can, luckily I have a very understanding employer, although travelling to and from hospital everyday is exhausting in itself. I want to keep working firstly because it is a welcome distraction from my illness and secondly because I need the money as a single person I would fine it difficult to manage on sick pay.  I have made a claim on my insurance but don't know yet if it will be successful they keep telling me the are waiting on doctors reports.  Does anyone else have experience of claiming on critical illness insurance cover for breast cancer?
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy - day 6 of 15

Posts.Content: does anyone have any advice on treating a common cold whilst undergoing cancer treatment. Common sense tells me to keep warm and take paracetamol but I am aware my immune system has been compromised so I don't want it to turn into something worse.
Posts.Title: the common cold

Posts.Content: There is someone at my local macmillan centre who does natural healing and meditation, I went to see her yesterday and did some guided meditation with her, which I found really beneficial.  They gave me a CD which I took to bed with me, I fell asleep before it finished playing, I had the best nights sleep for about 2 weeks,  I hope that continues.  I will give anything a try a few hours of quality sleep is better than a long night of broken sleep.
Posts.Title: Sleepness nights

Posts.Content: I haven't had a decent nights sleep since my diagnosis, my body wants to sleep but my mind won't let me. Apart from sleeping tablets can anyone recommend any techniques to help me get some rest.
Posts.Title: Sleepness nights

Posts.Content: I went for my pre-op assessment yesterday and I managed to get a decent nights sleep.  I am hoping that continues, I am booked in for surgery on Thursday, so maybe I will be able to sleep now things have started happening, all that waiting around is exhausting.
Posts.Title: Sleepness nights

Posts.Content: Just when you think you can move forward, something else comes along to knock you off your feet.  I have been through surgery and radiotherapy now they tell me I have to have a hysteroscopy because I had some spotting a few weeks ago. You cannot help thinking the worst while hoping for the best.
Posts.Title: hysteroscopy

Posts.Content: I had the procedure done before Christmas, which was difficult and painful,  unfortunately they did not get a good enough sample. I have to have it done again under general anaesthetic. Thank you for your kind wishes.
Posts.Title: hysteroscopy
